alert.note: Alert for Scotland; Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 05 at 8:17PM EDT until April 05 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Cumberland, Durham, Harnett, Hoke, Lee, Moore, Richmond, Scotland and Wake. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas and ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 816 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This may cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Raleigh, Durham, Fayetteville, Cary, Sanford, Laurinburg, Southern Pines, Raeford, Lillington, Carthage, Fort Bragg, Wake Forest, Garner, Fuquay-Varina, Pinehurst, Dunn, Aberdeen, Zebulon, Angier and Godwin.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Slow down and use caution while driving to avoid hydroplaning. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
